meanings.definition: Relating to or located in the area of a disc.
meanings.sent1: The discal shape of the object made it easy to fit into the slot.
meanings.sent2: The discal pattern on the rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The discal design of the cake made it look like a giant cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her discal earrings gleamed like miniature mirrors in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The discal outline of the clock made it stand out among the other decorations.

meanings.definition: Resembling a disc in shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The discal object rolled smoothly across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The discal flower petals were perfectly round and symmetrical.
meanings.sent3: The discal pizza looked like a giant cheesy frisbee.
meanings.sent4: Her discal hat shielded her face from the sun like a wide brim.
meanings.sent5: The discal mirror reflected the entire room in its circular surface.
